event.title: documented in the Cartulary of Moray in 1190 AD

data.event: Elgin is first documented in the Cartulary of Moray in 1190 AD.

event.title: August 1040, MacBeth's army defeated and killed

data.event: In August 1040, MacBeth's army defeated and killed Duncan I at Bothganowan (Pitgaveny), near Elgin.

event.title: is first recorded in a charter of David I in 1151

data.event: Elgin is first recorded in a charter of David I in 1151 in which he granted an annuity to the Priory of Urquhart.

event.title: had made Elgin a royal burgh around 1130

data.event: David had made Elgin a royal burgh around 1130, after his defeat of Ã“engus of Moray.

event.title: was established at the top of what is now

data.event: During David's reign the castle was established at the top of what is now Lady Hill.

event.title: received a royal charter from Alexander II in 1224

data.event: The town received a royal charter from Alexander II in 1224 when he granted the land for a new cathedral to Andrew, Bishop of Moray.
